message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of action recognition using depth images, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method also involves the use of random forests, which is a popular machine learning technique in robotics (cs.RO) and also in computer vision (cs.CV). The integration of kinematic-layout information in the learning process suggests the involvement of techniques related to feature engineering and representation learning, which are common in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the experimental evaluations involve the use of datasets and techniques related to multimedia (cs.MM).
